result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:41 Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim's father Brian Ascher makes a statement.
Jury trial - 12 person at 08-26-2015 08:30 am
cover letter from Doctor Galli
Pre-trial conference at 08-07-2015 10:00 am

11:31 a.m.  Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review NGI report.  Atty. Slattery states he does not agree with the findings.  Court will review again at the PTC.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Fax Confirmation
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Competency hearing at 06-25-2015 11:00 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-27-2015 08:30 am
Fax Confirmation
for Examination under 971.16

4:08 Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Slattery enters a not guilty by reason of mental defect and will prepare the order.  Court sets the matter for pre-trial date.  Bond Continued.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.

3:05 Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Christine Giacomino is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to her employment with Marshfield Police Dept.  Testifies to conversation with EKW on 05/07/14 regarding child abuse.  Testifies to information she received about injury sustained by EKW.  Observed a mark consist with a bite mark on EKWs arm.  EKW stated it hurt and she cried.  Testifies to contact with Amanda regarding the incident.  Identifies Amanda Weinfurtner in the courtroom.  

Atty Slattery cross examines the witness.  Describes the bite mark.  Skin was not broken.  Testifies to conversation with child explaining why she was biten by her mother.  

Court finds probable cause and proceeds to Arraignment.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Cooperate with Wood County Human Services.

9:11 Defendant Amanda J Weinfurtner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Transferred to Branch 2 for preliminary hearing. Waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
(Defendant)
